email.title: Weekly Digest

image.alt: Picture of a cup of tea with two cigarette biscuits leaning against the tea plate
image.title: Cigarettes Russes

email.text:
Hi everyone! Here's yet another digest.
First off, thanks to everyone who came to the Welcome Bar Night last Thursday. We had a great attendance of 350 members and hope everyone who went enjoyed it! For those who missed it, no worries - there will be many more bar nights to come (including one with Netcraft _this coming Thursday_!).
To reiterate from the last digest, all of our industrial events are catered (usually with pizza). If you have any dietary requirements and if you are planning on attending an event, please make sure you [get in touch](mailto:docsoc@imperial.ac.uk) at least two days before the event to tell us. You can use the same email address to give us any feedback about our events as well!
This digest is packaged with information and events, so stay tuned and read on!
email.heading: Mums and Dads Subsidy
email.text:
Part of the Mums and Dads scheme but haven't met up with your family for food and drinks yet? DoCSoc are subsidising up to £20 for families to get to know each other! If you're a parent, you're eligible to claim £20 back for a family meetup, no matter whether you're introducing your children to curly fries at the Union or hiring a squash court at Ethos.
To get the reimbursement, you'll need to be sure to ask for and hold onto a receipt and make a claim over [eActivities](https://eactivities.union.ic.ac.uk/training/articles/13) to CGCU DoCSoc (605).
Feel free to [get in touch](mailto:docsoc@imperial.ac.uk) if you have any questions.
email.heading: Year Representatives
email.text:
In our first digest of the year, we introduced your departmental representatives (dep reps), responsible for representing Computing, JMC and EIE students to the department. With Autumn elections now over, your _year_ representatives (year reps) have now been announced!
Academic year reps are responsible for issues relating to your year group (e.g., work not returned on time, too much coursework being scheduled at one time, etc.). Wellbeing year reps are people you can speak to confidentially on a personal level. Feel free to contact them over Messenger and they will be happy to get back to you!
There's a lot of representatives to list, so we encourage you to take a brief look at your year reps: - [Computing](https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/your-union/your-representatives/a-to-z/computing-ug) - [JMC](https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/your-union/your-representatives/a-to-z/jmc-ug) - [EIE](https://www.imperialcollegeunion.org/your-union/your-representatives/a-to-z/electronic-information-engineering-ug)
Also, in case you forgot, here are our dep reps: - **Computing**: Martin Zlocha ([email](mailto:dep-rep@doc.ic.ac.uk)) - **Joint Maths and Computing (JMC)**: Rachel Mekhtieva Lee and Fawaz Shah ([email](mailto:dep-rep@doc.ic.ac.uk)) - **Electronic and Information Engineering (EIE)**: Willem van der Schoot (Academic, [email](willem.van-der-schoot16@imperial.ac.uk)) and Mayank Surana (Wellbeing, [email](mayank.surana16@imperial.ac.uk))
email.heading: Sponsors' Portal
email.text:
Searching for internships or placements? Check out our Sponsors Portal, where you can find out more details about our sponsors, read their blog posts and see their open internship/placement positions. You can also upload your CV and directly apply to all of our Gold and Silver tier sponsors!
You can access the portal at: https://portal.docsoc.co.uk
email.heading: Competition Winners
email.text:
At the Welcome Bar Night, we announced the winners of different competitions we hosted over the past few months. Here are the winners again!
At Freshers' Fair, we gave freshers the chance to compete in a **typing competition** to win great prizes. The winners are: - TODO - TODO - TODO
Last year, we entered those who completed the **End of Year Survey** into a raffle for a £50 Amazon voucher. The winners of the raffle are: - TODO
During the Mums and Dads meeting, we created a bingo-like checklist. The winners of the **Mums and Dads Checklist** won an additional subsidy to spend at a family meetup. The winners are: - TODO
If you have not collected your prize please get in touch with us and we will give it to you at a convenient time!
Thanks for everyone who participated in these events and congratulations to those who won!
email.heading: Palantir - Interpreting Law and Policy as Technologists

event.text:
In May 2018, the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) became one of the most important reforms of data protection law worldwide. Strangely, this law did not come with technical specifications. Join Paula Kift, of the Privacy and Civil Liberties team at Palantir, for a workshop that aims to highlight for those interested in the intersection of law and technology how they can shape it in practice, while tackling some of the most important privacy challenges of our time.
Food and drinks provided!
**Please RSVP using the link provided** before clicking 'Going' on Facebook.

email.heading: Netcraft - Cryptocurrencies for Fun and Profit

event.text:
Rolling your own cryptocurrency: what could possibly go wrong?
Over the past few years, the popularity and value of cryptocurrencies, such as Bitcoin, has soared. Bitcoin has also spawned a number of spinoff currencies, known as 'altcoins'. Some altcoins provide genuine technical improvements over Bitcoin; however, most are forks with minimal changes - designed to be pump and dump schemes to enrich their creators.
In July 2018 Imperial College jointly published a report written by Prof William Knottenbelt with eToro, a cryptocurrency exchange. The report was widely regarded by the press to be a puff piece promoting cryptocurrencies, poorly disguised as academic research. The Financial Times dubbed it "cryptopuff".
Not wanting to miss out on the fun (or profit!), Netcraft has designed its own cryptocurrency and named it Cryptopuff in tribute to Prof Knottenbelt's report. However, Cryptopuff was written in a rush during a single weekend - who knows what vulnerabilities may be lurking in its depths?
Your challenge, after a short talk illustrating the concepts, is to compete against your peers to earn as much Cryptopuff as possible.
You'll need to find and exploit vulnerabilities to steal coins from your peers, while also defending your own node against attack to protect your own coins. Or perhaps you could sell 'zero-day' vulnerabilities to other teams rather than doing the dirty work of exploiting them yourself.
The team with the greatest number of coins at the end of the event will be declared the winner.
To take part, bring your own laptop with a web browser and an SSH client (e.g. Putty http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/ for Windows users; OpenSSH for Linux/Mac users)
**There will a free bar night at the Union Bar after the competition.**

email.heading: Netcraft Breakfast

event.text:
Get your Friday off to a great start with DoCSoc's first free breakfast of the year, generously sponsored by Netcraft! Come along to Huxley 341/342 any time from 8am-10am and enjoy a great pre-lecture breakfast with other DoCSoc members.
If you have any specific dietary requirements, please let us know a few days beforehand!
You can learn more about Netcraft at https://www.netcraft.com!

email.heading: Tech Talk @ BlackRock's Offices

event.text:
**Do you want to have a career that’s exciting, rewarding and full of possibilities? Are you driven by change and making an impact?**
Join us at this Technology @ BlackRock event to learn how you can put your ideas to work at one of the largest FinTech firms in the world!
At this event we will be delivering a Tech Talk on Continuous Deployment/Containerisation and Cloud. You’ll also hear more about our opportunities, network with current BlackRock employees and receive advice on how to make a successful application!
Since our inception in 1988, we’ve grown from an entrepreneurial start-up into the world’s largest investment manager, with more than $6 trillion of assets under management, by putting technology and continuous innovation at the heart of our business.
Join us and learn how you can make an even bigger impact.
Upload your CV [here](https://blackrock.tal.net/vx/lang-en-GB/mobile-0/brand-3/xf-16a200d7d3fb/candidate/so/pm/1/pl/2/opp/2817-Technology-BlackRock-London/en-GB) to register your interest in attending this event.
**Registrations will close on Monday 22 October.**
_Economy Travel Expenses from outside London (from £25 up to £100) will be reimbursed. Taxi fares will not be reimbursed._

email.heading: Bank of America "Discover Technology" Office Visit

event.location: Bank of America Merrill Lynch Offices
event.text:
Bank of America Merrill Lynch are looking for **first year students** interested in their Spring Week and **penultimate year students** interested in internships to come along to their offices and learn more about the Bank and their tech (drinks and canapés provided!).
---
Technology touches every part of Bank of America Merrill Lynch and underpins each deal we make. Owing to our investment in leading technology the Global Technology division places growth and success as a central part of its strategy. This gives our business the competitive edge to solve business problems delivering high quality and practical solutions. Did you know that the banks mainframe environment is the third largest in the world?
Join us for our exclusive **‘Discover Technology’ event** at our St Paul’s offices for Imperial students only on **Monday 29 October 6pm-8pm**.
During the event you will find out more about Bank of America Merrill Lynch and the important role our Technology division has in the running of our business. We’ll have a number of representatives on hand to give you an insight into our campus programs, what we look for in students, and what it would be like to work for us – in addition to an opening presentation from a senior Director, you’ll also have the chance to network over drinks and canapés with Imperial alumni as well as get a tour of our offices!
This is a fantastic opportunity for students who have either already applied for one of our programs and would like to follow up with a networking opportunity, or to those considering whether to apply – this event should help you in putting in the best application you can.
Spaces are limited, so apply as soon as possible!
Please click [here](https://bankcampuscareers.tal.net/vx/brand-5/candidate/so/pm/1/pl/2/opp/3331-UK-Imperial-College-Discover-Technology-at-Bank-of-America-Merrill-Lynch/en-GB) to register for this event.

email.heading: Google DevFest London 2018

event.text:
DoCSoc is proud to be hosting Google DevFest London on our very own campus this year! Read on for more information.
**Learn the latest in web, mobile, cloud, machine learning and more at the UK's largest community organised free conference.**
GDG London, Google and DoCSoc present GDG Devfest London - a multi-track event covering: cloud and machine learning; web; mobile; assistant; codelabs and demos.
To find out more about speakers, topics and agenda, visit devfest.gdg.london
Don’t miss out on a fun, interesting and informative day of expert speakers, demo stands coding labs and much much more.
You’ll also get the chance to network with experts from Google, Imperial College and beyond and learn more from some of the amazing developer communities we have in London.
There will be people taking photographs and potentially filming the event. By attending you agree to the possibility of being photographed and filmed once inside the venue.
Thank you for your interest in GDG DevFest London and we look forward to seeing you there!

email.heading: Palantir Opportunities
email.sponsor: Palantir is hiring across all roles in London and beyond! We are looking for strong engineers to help us continue helping the worlds most important institutions solve their most challenging problems using data. Find out more here: https://www.palantir.com/students/
email.heading: Internships at Artificial
email.sponsor:
Interested in working in software engineering or data science? Artificial is hiring so if you are, be sure to read on!
We're a start-up in the insurance technology sector. Our mission is to make the insurance process frictionless. We do this by enabling insurance companies to leverage innovative technology so they can make their customers happier, act more efficiently, and scale faster. We are dedicated to building the advanced and flexible machine learning enabled insurance platform to cater for insurers, brokers and underwriters of all sizes and sectors.
We're looking to recruit interns for summer 2019 in software engineering and data science. Check us out at https://artificial.io/ and apply at https://artificial.workable.com/.
